StateChangeEventHandler Delegate

Definition

Represents the method that will handle the StateChange event.

In this Article

public delegate void StateChangeEventHandler(object sender, StateChangeEventArgs e);
Inheritance
Object
System.Delegate
StateChangeEventHandler

Remarks

When you create a StateChangeEventHandler delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event handler delegates, see NIB: Events and Delegates.
